Dear Ms. French:
This letter is a follow-up to the Department’s findings regarding the interim inspection
conducted at your facility on 06/11/2020. The purpose of this inspection was to determine
compliance with applicable licensing statutes and administrative rules for Court Operated
Residential Care Facility.
The violations that were found are:
R 400.10113 Employee records.
Employee records shall be maintained for each employee and
shall include all of the following information:
(d) Three references which are obtained before employment
from persons unrelated to the employee.
One of nine new hire employee files reviewed lacked three references as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection Report dated 06/20/19, CAP approval date 07/22/19
Interim Inspection Report dated 08/08/18, CAP approval date 08/14/18
Employee References have been cited during the past two audits with Corrective Action
Plans (CAP) approved. The 2018 CAP required Muskegon County Juvenile Transition
Center Administration to review required personal records prior to conditional job offer.
The 2019 CAP required Muskegon County Juvenile Transition Center Administration,
along with the Administrative Support Staff review required personal records prior to
conditional job offer and complete the New Hire Checklist. These CAPs have proven to

www.michigan.gov/lara  517-335-1980

be ineffective as the facility continues to be in non-compliance. The facility will need to
develop and CAP that is specific with continuous monitoring to ensure future
compliance.
A virtual tour of the facility occurred on June 9, 2020 due to COVID-19. The facility was
observed to be well maintained, clean and organized. Meal menus were posted. During
the tour residents were observed playing cards, or in their bedrooms. Staff interviewed
reported feeling supported by management and being provided with direction. Staff
indicated there have not been many physical managements performed throughout the
year and they have adequate training to do so as a last resort. Both staff and residents
noted concerns that at times the facility is too laxed allowing residents to play video
games, or earn privileges making residents want to be at the facility. Residents reported
having ample support, activities, education, and services at the facility. Residents and
Staff stated they feel safe at the facility. A sample of restraint and seclusions
documentation were reviewed by this consultant. All incidences reviewed, staff
responded appropriately and there were no concerns noted.
Due to the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Repeat violations must include an explanation of why the previous
corrective action plan did not result in compliance.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
The Department provides technical assistance to meet the licensing requirements and
consultation to improve services. Please contact me with any questions. In the event that
I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact the
local office at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,
Jessica VandenHeuvel, Licensing Consultant
